page.title: 02SCHOOL-HALF A CENTURY BACK
page.content: How different school is now than when I started 50 years ago! Then the Infants were taught in the small room, about 6 metres square,now used as an office.The present Hall of the school was then divided into 2 classrooms by a wooden partition. At 9a.m.a bell was rung & the children lined up in the playground before marching into school Hymns were sung,pupils accompanying on the piano.Passages from the Bible & poems were copied out & learnt. Tables were learnt by heart & no computers! Punishment was a 100 lines-"I must not talk"! There were no school lunches provided,only milk,heated in cold weather,at break time.One coal fire provided our only warmth & there was no running water- the toilets were at the far end of the plyground outside & we washed our hands in an enamel bowl in the cloakroom.
